description: From Hebrew גְּנִיזָה‎ (g'nizá, “archiving, preservation, storage; hiding; genizah”) (plural גְּנִיזוֹת‎ (g'nizót)), from Old Persian *ganza-, from Old Median *ganza- (“depository; treasure”).

nouns.description: genizah (plural genizahs or genizot or genizoth)

entries.meaning: (Jewish law) A depository where sacred Hebrew books or other sacred items that by Jewish law cannot be disposed of are kept before they can be properly buried in a cemetery.
examples: The Cairo Genizah was discovered in 1896.
